text: Enfield Town railway station is the most central of many stations in Enfield, in northeast London. It is the endpoint of a branch line from Liverpool Street, one of the Lea Valley Lines. The station, and all trains serving it, is operated by London Overground. The station is in Travelcard Zone 5. Trains on the Hertford Loop Linego through Enfield. Enfield Chase railway station is on the opposite side of the town centre. The nearest station on the West Anglia Main Line is at Ponders End. ==Gallery== Image:Enfield Town stn platform 1 northbound.JPG|Platform 1 looking north to buffers Image:Enfield Town stn platform 2 southbound.JPG|Platform 2 looking south image:Enfield Town stn platform 3 northbound.JPG|Platform 3 looking north to buffers, with unit 315848 awaiting departure from platform 2 Image:Enfield Town stn signage.JPG|Platform signage with new National Express logo ==Related pages== *Enfield Lock railway station *Enfield Chase railway station == References == ==Other websites== * Category:London Travelcard zone 5 Category:Railway stations in the London Borough of Enfield Category:1849 establishments in England Category:Railway stations served by National Express East Anglia
title: Enfield Town railway station
